column4: Hi guys! Ubuntu newbie trying to install 9.04 and getting some strangeness- any help gratefully received
hi sebsebseb -  no matter how many times I run the MD5 etc. and d/l the ubuntu server to install
I always get a debootstrap error
sebsebseb- the error is 'file:///cdrom/pool/main/u/ubuntu-meta/ubntu-minimal_1.140_i386.deb was corrupt
strangely though, when I check the CD if it's intact, it passes
I've naturally googled this, but there's nothing out there
where did you d/l the iso from?
and it passes ok when you check the cd for defects
hmmm- good point, it's a machine we got given by a colleague
any way I could look into that?
yeah, I think that'd be the way forward too- I just heard great things for 9.04
ok, thanks for your time guys!
can you possibly try the cd on a different system?
